Customer ID in in the Sensor download page. Client ID is on A. D is correct verified in console

chatgpt: In the Falcon console, the Customer ID (CID) can be located on the:

A. API Clients and Keys page

This page typically contains information related to API access and management, including the unique identifier assigned to the customer or organization, which is the Customer ID (CID). The CID is an important piece of information often required for various configurations and integrations within the Falcon ecosystem.
D is correct. A has Client ID, and not Customer ID.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

discussion.content:

Selected Answer: A
Uninstalling using the command line
Download CSUninstallTool from Tool Downloads
Open a command prompt with administrative privileges and run this command:
CsUninstallTool.exe /quiet

questions.question_text: Which of the following tools developed by CrowdStrike is intended to help with removal of the CrowdStrike Windows Falcon Sensor?

choices.D: The Falcon Sensor would start at reboot and generate an Agent ID
choices.C: The Falcon Sensor would disable BIOS checks at startup
choices.B: The Falcon Sensor would not automatically start on reboot. It would have to be manually started
choices.A: The Falcon Sensor would start, but only send a heartbeat to the Falcon console

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Just Check the Exam Practice.

Selected Answer: D
Just checked the documentation "Prevents the sensor from starting up after installation. The next time the host boots, the sensor will start and be assigned a new agent ID (AID)"

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, If you restart the VM template before you convert the VM to a VM template image, host created with that template will all share an AID.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. NO_STAR option is for VM template. It generate Agent ID after reboot.
